name: Stories Through Collage - Zine Making Workshop
description:
We will be exploring relationships using abstract collage. Colors, shapes and textures influence our emotions in very strange ways. You will also learn the visual vocabulary to express your emotions through collage. Come and join us for this zine making workshop!
Keerthana Srinivasan aka Keena is an author/illustrator of a silent picture book, a memoir for adults. You can get her signed copies of the book after this session.

name: Lakshmi’s Little Bird - Book Launch
description:
Atta Galatta is hosting the launch of Lakshmi's Little Bird, the first picture book by illustrator-author Sharanya Kunnath on the 28th of July at 12:30 PM.
All Lakshmi wants is a bird buddy – her very own pakshi.
After all, every cow has a bird. That's what her Amma says.
One by one, many birds come, but they don't stay. With a skip in her step and a twinkle in her eye, Lakshmi waits…
Until one day, there is a flutter of wings and a burst of laughter... A chatty, chirpy bird comes her way. Will this one stay?
Will Lakshmi finally find her forever friend?
Bring along your children, nieces, nephews or friends (aged 5 and up) and join in for a reading of the book followed by a fun drawing activity, and then a book signing at 13:30. Adults are also welcome to attend. Make sure you dress in your best blue, yellow or pink clothes and bring along color pencils/crayons and paper.
Watch the book trailer for a peek into Lakshmi's story:
https://www.instagram.com/reel/C9O7OY7y45m
Lakshmi says mooooo, and we can't wait to see you all there!

name: Think The Luna Way - Book Launch
description:
“Think the Luna way" process is crafted especially for you. Formulated at Threadality Technologies, "Think the Luna way" was born from a thorough analysis of the pitfalls encountered during our product development cycles. This process ensures no feature is left behind and helps you build a strong foundation for your ideas before you even start building them.
"Think the Luna way" is more than just a guide; it’s a journey through the innovative process that revolutionized how Threadality Technologies approaches product development. Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, this book provides the insights and tools you need to refine your creative and development processes.
Mukundh Bhushan is the founder and CEO of Threadality Technologies. His entrepreneurial journey began in a college dorm room at the age of 19, where he had to manage every aspect of his IT business on his own. This experience, though challenging, laid the foundation for his future success. Mukundh has navigated the complex world of entrepreneurship by teaching and training himself, overcoming numerous challenges along the way. His book is a reflection of his ongoing journey, sharing invaluable lessons on showcasing work, recruiting and managing teams, and most importantly, efficient thinking.
In "Think the Luna way" you will learn about a comprehensive process that guarantees no feature is left behind. The book emphasizes the importance of building a solid foundation for your ideas before diving into the actual creation. Mukundh shares his insights on efficient thinking and effective strategies, a skill critical for any entrepreneur or innovator. The book is filled with real-life lessons and practical advice drawn from Mukundh’s personal experiences in starting and growing a successful tech company.
Join us for the launch of "Think the Luna way" and embark on a transformative journey that will empower you to turn your ideas into reality. The event will take place on 28th July between 1:30 to 2:30 PM in the afternoon.
Get ready to redefine your approach to design and development with "Think the Luna way" by Mukundh Bhushan!

name: Build-A-Book - Book Making Workshop
description:
Build -A- Book is a carefully curated skill-based workshop about bookmaking. The participants will experiment together and learn how to transform ordinary household objects to repurpose them into journals and notebooks, and experiment with other materials!
Saachi will be sharing all tips and tricks that she has learned and gathered over her 5 years of experience and practice with the skill. She will also be working with the participants to sharpen their observation skills and imagination to help them customise notebooks and journals to suit their needs and purpose.

name: Poetic Musings - Book Launch
description:
"Poetic Musings" by Dr. Padmashree R P invites readers on an enchanting journey through the human experience. This collection weaves a tapestry of diverse themes, from the paradox of freedom to the life-giving power of rain, from storytelling magic to rediscovering latent talents. Dr. Padmashree's verses resonate with collective strength and civic duty, urging readers to explore their inner depths.
The standout poem, "The Whispering Attic," poignantly explores time's passage and the desire to rekindle dormant passions. It serves as a metaphor for the hidden treasures of knowledge and talent within us all.
A central theme is the profound interconnectedness of all things. The poems illuminate the delicate threads binding humans, nature, and the cosmos, fostering a sense of unity and shared destiny.
These verses are catalysts for introspection and personal growth, challenging readers to reflect deeply on their experiences and inspiring a renewed appreciation for life's complexities. Join us to launch this exhilarating work on Sunday, 28th July, at 7.30 PM.
Dr. Padmashree R. P. is an accomplished teacher trainer and Karnataka Educational Services Officer with over 33 years of extensive experience in the education sector. She is also a passionate Academic writer, poet and story writer.

name: Gypsy's Run on Wednesday - Book Reading
description: Enjoy a book reading and interactive session with author May Zareah. She is the author of Vodka Sambar and her second book ‘Gypsy’s Run on Wednesday’ has just been launched. Do come for an insightful session on how to get your bread, butter and biriyani, and relish a world of books!

name: Kuch Kehta Hai Yeh Saawan - Kannada, Hindi and Marathi Music Performance
description:
The Trio singing group will present an evening of soulful woven tunes, film compositions celebrating monsoon season, infused with poetry through this curated concert providing a holistic and culturally enriching experience. They will be accompanied by Rohit Kumar, leading Keyboard artist.        
Watch the best of field perform live, feel the vibrations of music being in the same space as the performers and witnessing the expressions create a thrilling experience for all. Listen to the unheard gems featuring monsoon songs, anecdotes, trivia and poetry and immerse yourselves in a captivating musical experience, that showcases talent and artistry of featured musicians. This group showcases the versatility and creativity of musicians who skilfully incorporate freshness in their singing, bringing a new perspective to familiar/unheard tunes. It's an artistic exploration and a deeper understanding of the interplay between tradition and innovation in music.
Pratibha Kulkarni - is an Indian playback singer and a voice over artist. She is a trained Hindustani artist and has rendered several Kannada film songs and has recorded songs for many albums in multiple Indian languages including Hindi, Marathi, Kannada, Gujrati, Rajasthani and Sanskrit. 
Rajeev Anand - is a professional singer and a performer. He has performed over 400+ shows in and around Bangalore till date.
Kunal Kushwaha - is a popular singer among club gigs and has been regularly performing all over Bangalore since many years.
Rohit Kumar - Leading Keyboard Artist who has delivered fantastic music across all concerts in Bangalore music circuit today.
Dr. Kavita - Anchor, Actress by passion and Doctor by profession who's been anchoring several leading concerts and events.
performer:
Kunal Kushwaha, 
Pratibha Kulkarni, 
Rajeev Anand, 
Rohit Kumar,

name: Wandering Thoughts - Listener's Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other's experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Chapter Carnival 2.0 - Literary Meetup
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View On Books, A Novel Club cordially invite you to the latest Library Meetup in town.
Join us for a innovative Library Meet wherein there`s over hundreds of books and you could pick a book in random and start reading together.
Have an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Come along with Empty Minds and fill it with rich literature from Atta Galatta’s Reading Section.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Reading minimum one chapter from a random book that you choose from the libary.
Participating in the ensuing curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: Don't Stop Acting 1.0 - Acting Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Acting Workshop in town. 
Join fellow aspiring actors and actresses for an inspiring session of learning acting through basics at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Our Acting workshop is designed for aspiring artists who wish to explore the fundamentals of acting and develop their performance skills in a supportive and engaging environment. This immersive workshop offers participants a thorough grounding in acting techniques, character development, and scene work, providing them with the tools needed to bring authenticity and depth to their performances.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no acting experience, as well as intermediate actors looking to refresh their skills. It is also suitable for anyone interested in improving their public speaking and presentation abilities.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the basic principles of acting.
- To develop participants` abilities to create believable and compelling characters.
- To enhance participants` skills in scene study and script analysis.
- To build participants` confidence in performing in front of an audience.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Acting Techniques
- Character Development and Analysis
- SCript Analysis and Interpretation
- Understanding Director`s Vision
- Conveying Emotions
- Physicality and Movement of Camera
- Improvization and Spontaneity
- Voice and Diction
- Working with Props and Costumes
- Rehearsals and Performances
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Participating in workshop with enthusiasm.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Keepsake: A Short Story Collection - Book Signing
description:
Join us for author Neha Gupta's book signing at Atta Galatta on 24th August, Saturday, at 3.30 PM, where she will be signing copies of her short story collection, Keepsake.
“Life gives us stories to tell!”
Old photographs, cherished letters, museums, flea markets and heirlooms. From the pressed flowers between the pages of a forgotten book to the humming of a vintage song, from nostalgic daydreams to soulful conversations, the art of keeping memories forever. Just like moments in life, some stories are light-hearted and some intense, each having a heart of its own. Keepsake is a beautiful collection of memories lived and remembered. 
Celebrating nostalgia and storytelling with a cup of tea and conversations.
